business.headline: 'Staying invested and staying patient': Radhika Gupta's advice after market surgeIndian stock markets surged over 3.7% on May 12, their strongest performance in nearly a year. The rally came after a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan over the weekend, along with positive signals from global markets and strong mutual fund inflows.

Crypto platforms asked to track J&K transactions for money laundering: ReportOver the last year, exchanges have made crypto withdrawals more restrictive, requiring users to provide more information about who is receiving the funds and why. These measures aim to curb misuse, given the anonymous and borderless nature of crypto.

Gold recovers as US-China tariff truce spurs bargain-buyingSpot gold was up 0.6% at $3,254.39 an ounce, as of 0639 GMT. Bullion recorded a 2.7% decline in the previous session. US gold futures GCcv1 were up 1% at $3,258.70.

Sensex drops over 1,200 points, but here's why you shouldn't panicThe market pulled back from the gains made in the last session. The Sensex dropped over 1,000 points in early trade, and Nifty also slipped as investors booked profits.

Yes Bank shares continue to rally, up 4% today. Buy, sell or hold?The stock has now climbed nearly 19% in just five trading sessions and 21% in a month, but top brokerages remain unconvinced. Most still have a 'sell' or 'neutral' rating on the lender.

ITR Filing 2025: All 7 forms out, key changes taxpayers must knowOne big change this year affects salaried individuals and small business owners who earn long-term capital gains (LTCG) from listed shares or mutual funds. If the gains are up to Rs 1.25 lakh a year, they can now file returns using ITR-1 or ITR-4 forms.

Explained: Why Swiggy shares fell up to 7% to hit 52-week low todaySwiggy shares have fallen around 45% since the beginning of the year. Over the past month, the stock has dropped 10%, and in the last three months, it has declined by 18%.

Tata Motors to announce Q4 results today. Here's what to expectTata Motors stock: The company's share price fell nearly 1% during morning trade on Tuesday. It opened at Rs 720.55 and dropped to a day's low of Rs 714.35 as investors showed caution ahead of the results.

India proposes retaliatory tariffs on select US goods over steel duties: ReportIndia is mulling retaliatory duties on select US goods exported to the country in response to Washington's tariffs on steel and aluminium products.

Sensex sinks over 1,200 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 1:03 pm, the BSE Sensex had dropped 1150.76 points to 81,285.65, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 284.80 points to 24,641.65. Most Nifty sectoral indices were mixed, reflecting broader uncertainty.
Sensex, Nifty in red after Monday's rally; IT stocks take biggest hitThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 1,000.64 points to 81,429.26, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 261.75 points to 24,662.95 as of 10:39 am.
Pharma stocks to be in focus today on Dalal Street. 3 things to knowThe sudden focus on pharmaceutical shares is due to a new executive order signed by US President Donald Trump on Monday.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue their rally today?GIFT Nifty on the NSE International Exchange was trading 26 points lower, or 0.10%, at 24,922 as of 8:13 am. This signals a weaker start for domestic markets on Tuesday, following Monday's steep gains.

Stocks to watch on May 13: Tata Steel, Hero MotoCorp, Airtel, Tata MotorsA ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan gave a boost to investor confidence on Monday, leading to a sharp rise on Dalal Street.

US-China tariff truce sparks Wall Street rally, S&P 500 hits two-month highWall Street surged Monday as the S&P 500 hit a two-month high, fueled by a temporary US-China tariff truce that eased trade war fears and boosted investor confidence in global markets.

Nissan to cut 20,000 jobs as losses mount and sales drop: ReportNissan recently warned that it expects a record net loss of 700-750 billion yen ($4.74–$5.08 billion) for the last financial year, mainly due to impairment charges.

ITR filing 2025: 6 Must-know tips before you file your tax returnBefore you even think about filing your tax return, make sure your Aadhaar is linked to your PAN. Also, choosing the correct ITR form is important. Filing the wrong one may lead to rejection of your return.

Sensex jumps nearly 3,000 points as India-Pakistan ceasefire fuels relief rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,975.43 points to close at 82,429.90, while the NSE Nifty50 added 916.70 points to end at 24,924.70.

Infosys, HCLTech, Tech Mahindra, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?The Nifty IT index surged over 6%, emerging as the top sectoral gainer on the NSE. Oracle Financial Services Software (OFSS) led the rally with a nearly 9% jump, followed by Coforge and Persistent Systems, which rose over 8% each. Blue-chip heavyweight Infosys gained close to 8%.

IndiGo takes off on D-Street with 10% jump: What's behind the rally?IndiGo's share price jumped as much as 9.78% to touch a high of Rs 5,599. By noon, the stock was trading 7.45% higher at Rs 5,479.85. With this rise, IndiGo's share price has gone up 19.35% so far in 2025.

Gold loses shine as US-China trade talks ease market jittersThe US and China ended high-stakes trade talks on a positive note on Sunday, with US officials touting a "deal" to reduce the U.S. trade deficit, while Chinese officials said they had reached an "important consensus".

Sensex surges over 3,000 points, best rally in a yearThe stock market rally was led by easing geopolitical tensions, supportive global cues, and renewed investor confidence after a sovereign credit upgrade.

IndusInd Bank faces tough questions from auditors over possible fraud: ReportSo far, IndusInd Bank has described the issue as a 'discrepancy'. This is the term it has used in its stock exchange notices and in talks with analysts and credit rating firms.

ITR Filing 2025: Opting for old tax regime? Here's why Form 10-IEA is a mustForm 10-IEA is a declaration form for those who do not want to follow the new tax regime. If you earn income from a business or profession, and you wish to continue with the old tax regime, this form is essential.

US and China pause tariff war for 90 days, to slash reciprocal duties by 115%Under the agreement, the US will reduce tariffs on Chinese goods from 145% to 30%, while China will slash its tariffs on American imports from 125% to 10%, according to a joint statement.

Dalal Street soars after ceasefire. Should you buy, hold or sell stocks?After today's euphoric rally driven by the ceasefire between India and Pakistan, investors are basking in green screens. But with uncertainty still looming, the big question remains—what should they do next?

YES Bank share price rises 9%. Here's whyThe stake sale news led to a rise in Yes Bank's stock price, making it one of the top gainers of the day. The share price of Yes Bank went up by as much as 9% during the trading session.

EPFO services simplified: Now check your PF balance with just a call or SMSBefore you use these services, make sure your Universal Account Number (UAN) is active and linked to at least one of these: your bank account, Aadhaar number or PAN. Also, your mobile number must be registered with your UAN on the EPFO portal.

Pakistan's stock exchange halts trading for an hour. Here's whyAccording to a notification from the Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX), all equity and equity-based markets were temporarily suspended after the KSE-30 index rose more than 5% from the previous session's close — the threshold for a market halt under PSX rules.

Eternal, Adani Ports, Infosys: Top stocks as Sensex jumps over 2,000 pointsEternal (Zomato) led the gains, surging nearly 5% to become the top performer on the 30-share BSE Sensex. Other major gainers included Adani Ports, NTPC and HCLTech, all trading up more than 4%.

Will India's trade with Turkey, Azerbaijan suffer amid tensions with Pakistan?Over the years, the trade between India and Azerbaijan has grown significantly, jumping from $50 million in 2005 to $1.435 billion in 2023. Further, India imported goods worth $1.235 billion and exported products worth $201 million to Azerbaijan, according to the official data.
Pakistan stock market jumps over 9% as India ceasefire brings calmPakistan's benchmark index surged over 9% on Monday, while Dalal Street also saw gains with Sensex and Nifty jumping 3%.

Sensex, Nifty up 3% after India-Pakistan ceasefire. What should investors do?With tensions easing and markets surging, global cues and earnings looking strong, should investors ride the momentum or wait for clearer signals before taking fresh positions?

Investors add Rs 11 lakh crore on D-Street: Which stocks are driving the rally?The Sensex jumped over 2,000 points, while the Nifty came close to the 24,700 mark. The overall mood on the street was upbeat, as investors welcomed signs of calm after days of concern.

Sensex surges over 3,000 points. Why is the stock market rallying today?Stock market rally today: The BSE Sensex was up 2,975.93 points to 82,430.40 at around 3:26 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 920.50 points to trade at 24,928.50.
Sensex rallies 2,000 points; Nifty above 24,500; RIL up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,915.43 points to 81,369.90, while the NSE Nifty50 soared 572.80 points to 24,580.20 as of 9:30 am.

Sensex, Nifty amid Indo-Pak tension: Key levels and sectors to watchForeign portfolio investors (FPIs), who had been buying stocks steadily for over two weeks, turned sellers on Friday. As per provisional exchange data, they sold shares worth Rs 3,798.71 crore.

Stock market opening: What to expect from Sensex, Nifty today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,552.5 as of 8:12 am, pointing to a likely 2% jump in the Nifty 50 index compared to Friday's close of 24,008.

Stocks to watch on May 12: Swiggy, Tata Steel, Adani Power, SBIA number of companies will be in focus today due to their quarterly results or key business updates, with investors hoping for  Sensex and Nifty to resume their winning run after having lost momentum last week amid rising Indo-Pak tensions.

Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

entertainment.headline: Cannes 2025: Homebound to Charak, Indian films set for global spotlightIndian films are making a strong mark at the Cannes Film Festival 2025 with films including 'Homebound', 'Aranyer Din Ratri', 'Tanvi The Great' and 'Charak'.

Rapper Tory Lanez attacked in prison while serving time in Megan Thee Stallion caseRapper Tory Lanez was stabbed 14 times while serving his time in California prison for shooting American rapper and songwriter Megan Thee Stallion.

Deepika Padukone lands her biggest pay cheque ever for Prabhas's SpiritBollywood actor Deepika Padukone is set to star alongside Telugu superstar Prabhas in the highly-anticipated film 'Spirit'. The film marks her return after motherhood and with a record-breaking remuneration.

Omniscient Reader 2nd trailer suprises as Lee Min-ho throws Ahn Hyo-seop into seaThe second teaser trailer for 'Omniscient Reader: The Prophet' is out. Ahn Hyo-seop, Lee Min-ho, and Blackpink's Jisoo battle to save humanity as a chaotic web novel world begins to collide with reality.

Cannes 2025: Leonardo DiCaprio to present Robert De Niro with honorary Palme d'OrActor Leonardo DiCaprio will present veteran actor Robert De Niro with the honorary Palme d'Or at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. The festival begins on May 13.

Govinda is 'ruining his life' sitting at home, says wife Sunita AhujaSunita Ahuja urged her husband, actor Govinda, to return to films, saying he is wasting his talent by staying away from the industry. She blamed bad company and outdated choices for his long absence from the screen.

What's next for Bollywood amid rising India-Pak tensions? Experts weigh inRising India-Pak tensions are influencing Bollywood's film release strategies. Trade experts remain hopeful as recent hits and upcoming big films signal industry recovery.
Actors Nitanshi Goel, Parul Gulati to make Cannes red carpet debutActors Nitanshi Goel and Parul Gulati will make their Cannes red carpet debut this year. The two will represent Loreal Paris.

Rishab Shetty remembers Kantara co-star Rakesh PoojaryKannada actor and comedian Rakesh Poojary died at the age of 33 after suffering a heart attack during a friend's function in Udupi. Kantara star Rishab Shetty paid tribute to him in an emotional Instagram post.

Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli visit Premanand Maharaj in VrindavanA day after announcing his retirement from Test cricket, cricketer Virat Kohli, along with his wife Anushka Sharma, arrived in Vrindavan to visit Premanand Maharaj. A video of the duo inside a cab is going viral.

Shaheer Sheikh had 'sleepless nights' over family's safety in Jammu, thanks ArmyShaheer Sheikh expressed deep gratitude towards the Indian Armed Forces amid rising tensions following Pakistan's attacks on Jammu, sharing his personal worries for his family in the region.

Behind every uniform there's a mother who hasn't slept: Alia Bhatt's powerful noteAlia Bhatt responded to the growing tension between India and Pakistan by sharing a heartfelt note dedicated to the brave individuals standing tall at the borders. On the occasion of Mother's Day, she also paid tribute to their mothers, giving them a special shoutout.

Kunal Kapoor backs Jewel Thief amid backlash: It wasn't supposed to be profoundKunal Kapoor responded to the backlash faced by Jewel Thief, emphasising the film's creative intent and strong performances. He stood firmly with co-stars Saif Ali Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat in the face of criticism.

Kartik Aaryan says 'warm and kind' SRK complimented him for Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2Kartik Aaryan revealed that Shah Rukh Khan complimented him for Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and said he enjoyed it. The actor also shared that he is shy when it comes to complimenting colleagues.

Ram Charan's daughter confuses wax figure with him, Upasana shares adorable momentRam Charan's daughter, Klin Kaara, adorably gatecrashed the unveiling of his wax statue, charming everyone in attendance. The heartwarming moment quickly went viral, capturing hearts across India.

Diddy Trial: Shocking hotel video shows alleged assault of Cassie VenturaSean "Diddy" Combs is on trial for sex trafficking and assault, with surveillance footage showing him allegedly attacking ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura. Prosecutors claim he abused women during coercive relationships.

Cannes Film Festival bans nudity and oversized outfits on red carpetThe Cannes Film Festival updates its red carpet dress code, banning nudity and oversized outfits. The new rules aim to enhance safety and decorum, balancing glamour with comfort and legal compliance at this high-profile event.

Ranveer Singh to Vicky Kaushal, celebs react to Virat Kohli's Test retirementVirat Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket on Monday. Bollywood actors like Ranveer Singh, Vicky Kaushal, and Suniel Shetty shared heartfelt tributes to honour his remarkable journey.

Mahira Khan, Mawra Hocane's pics removed from album covers amid India-Pak clashPakistani actors Mahira Khan and Mawra Hocane's images were removed from the album covers of 'Raees' and 'Sanam Teri Kasam' amid the India-Pakistan conflict.

general news.headline: How PM Modi's visit to Adampur airbase debunked Pak's S-400 claimDuring PM Modi's visit to Adampur, an image of an MiG-29 jet and an intact S-400 air defence system was visible in the background. It debunked Pakistan's claim that its jets destroyed the S-400 air defence system.

3 Lashkar terrorists killed in gunfight with security forces in J&K, AK-47s seizedThe Army launched Operation Keller -- named after the encounter site -- after it received "specific intelligence" from the Rashtriya Rifles unit. Of the three, the two slain terrorists were identified as Shahid Kuttay and Adnan Shafi, both residents of Shopian.

Clear satellite pics show extensive damage to Pak bases after Indian strikesThe post-strike satellite images of the highest quality released by Maxar Technologies offer clear evidence of India's precision airstrikes on key military facilities in Pakistan.

Pakistan to revalidate emergency airstrips after Indian strikes cripple basesSources confirm that revalidation exercises for the M1 and M2 emergency airstrips - located on the Islamabad-Peshawar and Islamabad-Lahore motorways - are scheduled for this week.

The nonchalance of Rohit, the intensity of Virat: Oh, what a jodi!More than any other batters in the post-Tendulkar era, stories of triumph and failure of Rohit and Virat became pivotal sub-plots. These narratives shaped the larger story of the game.

Live: Flight operations resume at J&K's Srinagar airport after 6 daysThree days after India and Pakistan reached an understanding to halt military action, the situation along the border remains largely calm, barring a few instances of drone sightings on Monday night. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in a strong and assertive speech on Monday, stated that Operation Sindoor has established a "new normal" in relations with neighbouring Pakistan. He reiterated that "blood and water cannot flow together" and warned Islamabad of a strong response in the event of any specific provocations or operations. Flight operations, which were widely disrupted, have begun to resume. However, some flights and airports remain non-operational. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

Mystery over drowning death of scientist who spearheaded India's Blue RevolutionPadma Shri awardee and aquaculture pioneer scientist Subbanna Ayyappan, who had been missing for several days, was found dead on May 10. His body was recovered from the Cauvery River at Srirangapatna and later identified by police. Though initial findings point to a possible suicide, authorities aren't ruling out other angles.

UK makes permanent residency norms tougher; Indians will be hit mostPrime Minister Keir Starmer unveiled the UK's immigration policy, doubling the wait time for permanent residency from 5 to 10 years. This will significantly impact Indian nationals, who are the largest group of immigrants to the UK. Starmer also vowed to introduce additional measures to curb immigration to the UK if needed.

Storm in Bangladesh as ex-President leaves for Thailand in lungi on 3 am flight  Former President Abdul Hamid left Bangladesh for Thailand in the wee hours last week, becoming the latest Awami League leader to slip out of the country after the fall of the Sheikh Hasina regime. A high-level probe has been constituted as to how Hamid was allowed to leave as he was an accused in at least one murder case. His exit coincides with the interim government of Muhammad Yunus banning the Awami League.

Sensex drops over 1,200 points, but here's why you shouldn't panicThe market pulled back from the gains made in the last session. The Sensex dropped over 1,000 points in early trade, and Nifty also slipped as investors booked profits.

Special experience: PM visits Punjab's Adampur air base, shares pics with jawansAdampur air base is one of the four key Indian Air Force (IAF) stations - Udhampur, Pathankot, Adampur, and Bhuj - that have suffered limited damage from Pakistani attacks amid the India-Pak tensions.

CBSE Board 10th, 12th Result 2025 OUT: 93.66% pass Class 10, 88.39% pass Class 12CBSE Board Results Class 10th 12th 2025 Live Updates: The CBSE 10th and 12th results have been declared today. Check your CBSE result on official websites cbseresults.nic.in, cbse.gov.in, results.cbse.nic.in. Get latest updates on scorecard, result timing, past trends, DigiLocker access and more.
Monsoon arrives early over Andaman & Nicobar Islands, IMD confirmsAccording to IMD observations, the region experienced persistent rainfall activity, showing the monsoon's progression.

Pak air force chief technician among 11 soldiers killed in Indian strikesThis is the first time Pakistan has confirmed that it lost air force personnel during India's 'Operation Sindoor', giving credence to the Indian Air Force's claim that it shot down 'a few planes' of the PAF.

Fact-check for Pakistan: Minister shares video of PM's Adampur air base visitThe Prime Minister's visit was significant as it demonstrated the air base was in fine condition, refuting reports of any damage.

How global media covered PM's Op Sindoor speech: India's 'new normal' on terrorThe global media's coverage of PM Modi's speech on Operation Sindoor spotlighted India's assertive tone, especially the warnings against nuclear blackmail and declaration of a "new normal" in India's counter-terrorism approach.

Govinda is 'ruining his life' sitting at home, says wife Sunita AhujaSunita Ahuja urged her husband, actor Govinda, to return to films, saying he is wasting his talent by staying away from the industry. She blamed bad company and outdated choices for his long absence from the screen.

Maharashtra SSC Result 2025 declared Live: Direct link to check MSBSHSE 10th results on sscresult.mkcl.orgMSBSHSE Maharashtra SSC Result 2025, mahresult.nic.in Live Updates: The Maharashtra State Board has announced the SSC 10th Result 2025 today, May 13. Over 15 lakh students can check their scores online at sscresult.mkcl.org and other official websites.

India proposes retaliatory tariffs on select US goods over steel duties: ReportIndia is mulling retaliatory duties on select US goods exported to the country in response to Washington's tariffs on steel and aluminium products.

Won't have any impact but expect it to be rolled back: Pak on India's Indus moveIn an interview with Reuters, Pakistani Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb said there is no immediate impact from India's suspension of the treaty and that Pakistan does not even want to consider any scenario that does not involve the agreement's reinstatement.

Man slams IndiGo's Rs 8,111 flight cancellation fee as 'thuggery', airline refunds fareThe Indigo passenger alleged that the airline deducted around 80% of his airfare after his flight was cancelled due to escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

Air India, IndiGo cancel flights to multiple cities today amid security concernsIndiGo and Air India cancelled flights to several northern and western cities for the day over security concerns. Flights to and from Amritsar, Jammu and Chandigarh, among other cities, have been cancelled.

Punjab woman injured in Pak shelling dies, 1st civilian casualty outside of J&KA woman, who was injured after Pakistan launched a drone attack targeting civilians in Punjab's Ferozepur on May 9, died after three days.

Am I really dying?: Bengaluru employee opens up about burnout after 14-hour workdaysIn a now-viral post on Reddit, an anonymous user described his struggle with a toxic work culture that, he said, has dominated his life since the start of his career.

All smoke, no screen time: How The Royals wasted Zeenat Aman's comebackVeteran actor Zeenat Aman makes her much-anticipated comeback in Netflix's 'The Royals', but her return leaves fans disheartened. Read to find out how her presence was reduced to ornamental screen time.

Cannes 2025: Homebound to Charak, Indian films set for global spotlightIndian films are making a strong mark at the Cannes Film Festival 2025 with films including 'Homebound', 'Aranyer Din Ratri', 'Tanvi The Great' and 'Charak'.

Rapper Tory Lanez attacked in prison while serving time in Megan Thee Stallion caseRapper Tory Lanez was stabbed 14 times while serving his time in California prison for shooting American rapper and songwriter Megan Thee Stallion.

Deepika Padukone lands her biggest pay cheque ever for Prabhas's SpiritBollywood actor Deepika Padukone is set to star alongside Telugu superstar Prabhas in the highly-anticipated film 'Spirit'. The film marks her return after motherhood and with a record-breaking remuneration.

sports.headline: RCB fans call on crowd to wear Test whites for Virat Kohli tribute vs KKRRCB fans plan to wear whites in emotional tribute to Virat Kohli's iconic Test career during the team's first match after IPL 2025's restart against KKR at the Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Both Kohli and Rohit deserved proper send-off, BCCI must look into it: Anil KumbleLegendary India spinner Anil Kumble feels that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma deserved proper farewells and the authorities must look into it. Rohit and Kohli announced their retirement from Tests within a space of six days.

Virat Kohli has set an example, often senior players are removed: Childhood coachStar India batter Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said that he has set an example by announcing his retirement as often senior players are forced to leave the team.

Virat Kohli brought the fitness culture to India Test team: Cheteshwar PujaraIndia batter Cheteshwar Pujara recalled how Virat Kohli revolutionised the team's Test cricket culture by prioritising fitness, intensity, and a results-driven mindset — setting new standards that reshaped the way India approached the red-ball format.

Virat Kohli arrives in Vrindavan with wife Anushka day after Test retirementVirat Kohli and his wife Anushka visited Vrindavan's Premanand Maharaj a day after his sudden Test retirement. The popular couple have made multiple visits to spiritual centres in recent years, often in times of transition as this one.

IPL 2025 set to clash with international calendar after resumptionThe Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) is all set to clash with the international calendar as it re-starts on May 17 with a fixture between Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) and Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

Sairaj breaks youth national records to win 81kg weightlifting goldSairaj Pardeshi stole the spotlight at the Khelo India Youth Games with three national records in weightlifting, while athletics saw multiple meet records shattered and Kerala surged up the medal tally with a kalarippayattu sweep.

Cameron Green returns as Australia name squad for WTC finalCameron Green's return headlines Australia's strong squad for the World Test Championship Final against South Africa, as Pat Cummins leads a balanced mix of experience and youth into the high-stakes clash at the Lord's Stadium in London.

Make Jasprit Bumrah Test captain: Sunil Gavaskar rubbishes workload concernsSunil Gavaskar believes Jasprit Bumrah was the ideal choice to lead India's Test team, dismissing concerns around his workload and backing the pacer's ability to manage his fitness and responsibilities as captain.

Did Virat Kohli time his Test retirement right?Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket, just 770 runs short of 10,000, marks the end of an era defined by passion, grit, and unmatched intensity. Despite calls to continue, Kohli chose to exit on his own terms—before the game could make the decision for him.

Shashi Tharoor pens special post for immortal Virat Kohli's Test retirementShashi Tharoor's emotional tribute to Virat Kohli captured the collective sentiment of fans, expressing admiration for the Test legend while lamenting the suddenness of his retirement without a farewell match on home soil.

Despite calls to continue, Kohli chose to exit on his own terms—before the game could make the decision for him.

Shashi Tharoor pens special post for immortal Virat Kohli's Test retirementShashi Tharoor's emotional tribute to Virat Kohli captured the collective sentiment of fans, expressing admiration for the Test legend while lamenting the suddenness of his retirement without a farewell match on home soil.

Australia board to support players' individual decisions on IPL 2025 returnCricket Australia has confirmed it will support players' individual choices regarding their return to IPL 2025, allowing them to prioritize safety, recovery, and preparation for upcoming international commitments, especially the World Test Championship final against South Africa.

The nonchalance of Rohit, the intensity of Virat: Oh, what a jodi!More than any other batters in the post-Tendulkar era, stories of triumph and failure of Rohit and Virat became pivotal sub-plots. These narratives shaped the larger story of the game.

India to go through a difficult transition phase, Sunil GavaskarIndia will go through a difficult phase of transition as they try to replace three senior players - R Ashwin, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, feels Sunil Gavaskar. Gavaskar said that any team in the world would have found it tough to replace three players in one go.

IPL 2025 to resume on May 17, 6 venues decided, final on June 3: BCCIIPL 2025: The BCCI confirmed that the Indian Premier League will restart on May 17 and the final will be played on June 3. The remainder of the season will be played across six venues.

Not surprised by Virat Kohli's Test retirement: Sunil GavaskarLegendary Sunil Gavaskar, speaking to India Today, said the selectors and the BCCI top brass would have discussed plans for the next cycle of the World Test Championship with both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, influencing their decisions to retire before the England tour.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will not play 2027 ODI World Cup: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has expressed doubts over Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's chances in India's 2027 ODI World Cup squad. Rohit and Virat will be 40 and 38 respectively by the time of the tournament.

Greatest coach in greatest team: Brazil welcomes Carlo AncelottiCarlo Ancelotti will become the head coach of Brazil after leaving Real Madrid. His appointment aims to restore Brazil's dominance ahead of the 2026 World Cup.
Pakistan prepares to restart PSL 2025 by May 16: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board is planning to complete the remainder of the Pakistan Super League in Rawalpindi and Lahore.

Not surprised by Virat Kohli's Test retirement: Sunil GavaskarLegendary Sunil Gavaskar, speaking to India Today, said the selectors and the BCCI top brass would have discussed plans for the next cycle of the World Test Championship with both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, influencing their decisions to retire before the England tour.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will not play 2027 ODI World Cup: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has expressed doubts over Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's chances in India's 2027 ODI World Cup squad. Rohit and Virat will be 40 and 38 respectively by the time of the tournament.

Greatest coach in greatest team: Brazil welcomes Carlo AncelottiCarlo Ancelotti will become the head coach of Brazil after leaving Real Madrid. His appointment aims to restore Brazil's dominance ahead of the 2026 World Cup.
Pakistan prepares to restart PSL 2025 by May 16: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board is planning to complete the remainder of the Pakistan Super League in Rawalpindi and Lahore.

Virat Kohli changed the way India competed overseas: BCCI presidentBCCI president Roger Binny has praised Virat Kohli for his exceptional leadership in Indian Test cricket. Kohli's retirement closes a significant chapter, highlighting his impact on India's overseas success and cricket culture.

Virat Kohli aimed for 3-4 tons in England, was ready to play for India A: Delhi coachDelhi's Ranji Trophy coach, Sarandeep Singh, said Virat Kohli was keen on playing for India in the tour of England in June. The former India spinner said Kohli had told him that he was ready to play practice matches with India 'A' team before the Test series.

Carlo Ancelotti to exit Real Madrid, Xabi Alonso to replace himCarlo Ancelotti will leave Real Madrid at the end of the season to coach Brazil. Xabi Alonso is set to replace him, aiming to lead Real into the new era.

Gill to Jaiswal: How India's NextGen reacted to Virat Kohli's Test retirementFrom Shubman Gill to Nitish Kumar Reddy, the next generation of Indian cricket paid glowing tribute to Virat Kohli after the star batter retired from Tests. "A true torchbearer who renewed our love for Test cricket," Reddy wrote, capturing the impact Kohli had on the format.

Virat Kohli retires: An ode to a Test captain and player who did things his wayVirat Kohli leaves Test cricket as one of the greatest batters for India in the format and as their best captain. Throughout his career, Kohli did one thing only – he played the game his way.

Virat Kohli's India instilled fear in opposition: Karthik on batter's legacyVirat Kohli has retired from Test cricket, ending an era of intense leadership and batting excellence. Dinesh Karthik speaks on the legacy that the batter leaves behind.

Mohammed Siraj's tribute to 'superhero' Virat Kohli wins heart from Anushka SharmaFast bowler Mohammed Siraj wrote an emotional tribute to Virat Kohli after the former captain retired from Test cricket on Monday, May 12. Siraj played eight Tests under Kohli's captaincy and played a key role in the famous win at Lord's in 2021.

Former Pakistan coach joins Bangladesh as pace bowling coachBangladesh roped in Shaun Tait as their pace bowling coach before the two-match T20I series against the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to be held from May 17.

CAB drapes Eden Gardens in banner in salute to armed forcesThe Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) paid tribute to the Indian armed forces by displaying a large banner on the Eden Gardens clubhouse. This heartfelt gesture honours the bravery, resilience, and dedication of the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force.

Where does Virat Kohli, India's greatest, stand among the best Test captains?Virat Kohli is India's most successful Test captain, with 40 wins from the 68 matches he led. But where does he rank among the greatest skippers Test cricket has ever seen?

Virat Kohli retires: Sachin Tendulkar tells untold story in emotional tributeSachin Tendulkar paid an emotional tribute to Virat Kohli, recalling a heartfelt gesture when he retired from international cricket after the Mumbai Test against West Indies in 2013.

Ravi Shastri shocked at Virat Kohli's retirement: Can't believe you are doneVirat Kohli has announced his retirement from Test cricket after an illustrious 14-year career. His departure marks the end of an era in Indian cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
